meanings.sent1: The sun will lumine the sky at dawn.
meanings.sent2: She used a flashlight to lumine the dark path.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies lumine the garden like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lumines the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse lumines the coastline, guiding ships safely.

meanings.definition: A source of light or illumination.
meanings.sent1: The candle served as a lumine during the power outage.
meanings.sent2: The stars in the night sky provide a natural lumine.
meanings.sent3: The lumine from the street lamps made the city feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a lumine in the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The lumine of the full moon lit up the forest like a magical lantern.
